title: Ethical Use of Secondary Sources
objective: Use commentaries, lexica, and historical tools responsibly and critically

required_passages.text: Observe responsible evaluation practices: receiving claims with openness and testing them by Scripture.

segments.audio_script: This is lesson sixteen. Focus on responsible use of secondary resources.
Read Acts 17:10-12 and identify habits of responsible evaluation and evidence-based study.
Secondary sources bring expertise but also interpretive biases. Evaluate their methods, assumptions, and data.
Cite secondary sources when they add verifiable data. Distinguish between evidence and opinion in their arguments.
Key practice: critical engagementâ€”use secondary sources to inform, not replace, primary textual work.
When should you rely on a commentary?
segments.correct_answer: When it provides verifiable data or helpful linguistic/historical insight

segments.audio_script: This completes lesson sixteen. Next lesson covers peer review and scholarly humility.

vocabulary.definition: Commentaries, lexicons, and scholarly works that interpret and analyze primary texts

study_notes: Record sources and reasons for accepting particular scholarly positions to maintain traceability.
